channel.title: No-ip
channel.description:
what do you mean you have to port forward? because i think i already did[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 10, 2008, 05:42:58 PM[/size][hr]I allowed the port through my firewall
I downloaded no-ip
i went to http://192.168.0.1
my modem/routers control panel
i went to advanced port forwarding
It showed this screen.
http://img225.imageshack.us/img225/1981/ippsyf6.jpg
for the ip address part, i went to the run promt, ipconfig, i took the gateway address and put this into the ip address part.
I ran my server, refreshed no-ip, and its still saying error connecting
*question, Im testing my server on my desktop computer, im entering klinec.zapto.org, since my desktop is conected to the same modem could this be the reason why its not working?

item.title: No-ip
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

zeb:

[quote]is it possible to disable my routers password or get it changed because i forgot the username and password iv tried all the defaults and i need to get into my router

ys there is a way. you can
1]phone up your router people answer questions they ask and set new pass
2]get a diff internet host
3]keep trying[/quote]

That’s a good one, isn’t the password stored ON the router itself, and just reset your router that simple.

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip
item.dc:creator: @runevault runevault
item.description:
@runevault wrote:

hey, i have a question about port forwarding.

first, my laptop is connected directly into my modem. do i still need to port forward?

and if so,

I have a quest highspeed modem/router

when i go into the control panel

I see advanced port forwarding, and dmz hosting, the dmz hosting one says this,

Your High Speed Internet DSL Modem can be configured to support online gaming and Internet conferencing services. To use this feature:
  1. Enter the IP Address of the computer in the DMZ Host IP Address field below.
  2. Make sure the circle next to On is selected
  3. Click Apply to save your changes.

and it has a ip box.

which one do i use?

also whats the starting port and ending port? and when i go to

ipconfig

it has the following ip address’s

which one do i use.

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 10, 2008, 04:22:51 PM[/size][hr]can someone add me on msn please for help

zorronux@hotmail.com

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip
item.dc:creator: @i_am_an_elf i am an elf
item.description:
@i_am_an_elf wrote:

[quote=“zeb, post:12, topic:172266”]u port foward? if not and your using a netgear router follow these steps:
go to:
start
run
type cmd
then type ipconfig
get ur gateway ip
type that gateway ip in ur internet browser
log in (if u got secure network)
when u loged in go to left side of page
scroll down
find this “Port Forwarding / Port Triggering”
click it
click add custom service
Service Name = your server name (not ip)
Service Type = tc[/udp
Starting Port = 5555
Ending Port = 43594
then if ur go back to start, run, cmd, ipconfig and get your ip adress and type it in the ip add box
click apply and your done enjoy =][/quote]

is it possible to disable my routers password or get it changed because i forgot the username and password iv tried all the defaults and i need to get into my router

Read full topic

still doesnt work

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

u port foward? if not and your using a netgear router follow these steps:
go to:
start
run
type cmd
then type ipconfig
get ur gateway ip
type that gateway ip in ur internet browser
log in (if u got secure network)
when u loged in go to left side of page
scroll down
find this “Port Forwarding / Port Triggering”
click it
click add custom service
Service Name = your server name (not ip)
Service Type = tc[/udp
Starting Port = 5555
Ending Port = 43594
then if ur go back to start, run, cmd, ipconfig and get your ip adress and type it in the ip add box
click apply and your done enjoy =]

Read full topic
